article_title: U.S. Company to Develop 100-MW Gas-Fired Power Plant in Myanmar
article_text:
APR Energy PLC has won a contract to build a 100-megawatt power plant in Myanmar, becoming the latest American company to join a small contingent that is plugging into Myanmar's potentially lucrative energy sector.

"This is a substantial investment," said Clive Turton, APR Energy's head of business development across Asia Pacific, declining to specify how much it will invest to develop the gas-fired project.

The...

twitter.description: APR Energy has won a contract to build the plant in the central Mandalay region, tapping the country's gas reserves to fuel the facility, which could serve six million electricity users.
twitter.creator: @ShibaniMahtani

article_metadata.article.origheadline: U.S. Company to Develop 100-MW Gas-Fired Power Plant in Myanmar

article_summary:
APR Energy PLC has won a contract to build a 100-megawatt power plant in Myanmar, becoming the latest American company to join a small contingent that is plugging into Myanmar's potentially lucrative energy sector.
"This is a substantial investment," said Clive Turton, APR Energy's head of business development across Asia Pacific, declining to specify how much it will invest to develop the gas-fired project.
